highlighted_text: how to solve problems using the computer
A programming paradigm is a way of conceptualizing what it means to perform computation and how tasks to be carried out on a computer should be structured and organized.

highlighted_text: process of decomposing problems and developing programming solutions.
Reusable software components permit the programmer to deal with problems on a higher level of abstraction.

A more accurate history would be that most of the principles of object-oriented programming were fully worked out by the developers of Simula but that these would have been largely ignored by the profession had they not been rediscovered by Kay in the creation of the Smalltalk programming language.
notes: this is just nonsense. Inheritence is not OOP.
